Reviews.Title: “Seattle Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful! Hotel undergoing renovation and it is going to be incredibly beautiful. Staff is very efficient and nice. Room was wonderful - very comfortable and modern. The location was perfect! We were visiting Cornish College of the Arts and it was a very short walk to the campus. We will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & great customer service for a budget”
Reviews.Author: priflores
Reviews.Content: My mom, grandma & aunts stayed here due to the decent reviews & very economical price. Upon arriving to check them in, we were surprised to see they were under construction. However the Front Office clerk confirmed that all the room renovations would be complete & you couldn't hear construction noise from the rooms. Once inside the rooms we were happily surprised to see he was right about the renovations & noise. The rooms were spacious, very clean & had nice amenities. A nice perk was the free popcorn in the room! There was a microwave as well, which was a very nice amenity. They also served complimentary continental breakfast every morning. It was about a 15/20 minute walk to the shopping/restaurant district downtown & you can even clearly see the Space Needle from some of the rooms. They happened to stay over St. Patty's day weekend & the front desk clerk gave my grandmother his beads, which I thought was very nice of him to treat her special!

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this facility in mid-February and found it very quiet, very clean and the staff extrem;y helpful. The lobby area was undergoing renovation and first impressions were that it was "rough" but our modestly priced room was more like a large suite and we've certainly paid far more for far less elsewhere. The king sized bed was comfortable and above all the room was spotless and from all appearances, the room had been recently renovated. Access to public transportation is a bit wanting but that will change as the Seattle LRT system is to be extended north. There are some reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance and for the tourists, the Seattle Space Needle is also within walking distance. We'd have no hesitation about recommending the Downtown La Quinta to anyone and in terms of value for money, it exceeds anything place I've ever previously stayed in the downtown Seattle core..

Reviews.Title: “Location, Cleanliness, Comfort, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: In seeking a hotel to fit my budget, I chose the La Quinta based on previous reviews as well as its location in downtown Seattle. I just returned home in mid-March from a three-night stay at this hotel, and would like to confirm the praises from previous reviewers. Everyone at the front desk was professional and helpful; you can tell they have a great team attitude, towards both the guests as well as one another. The staff is youthful and enthusiastic and you just feel good from the moment you walk in. I reserved a room with a king bed, microwave and refrigerator. I asked for a quiet room with a view and was delighted to be on the top floor with a great view of downtown Seattle. My room was spotless. The décor was comfortable, the room was spacious and the bathroom was recently remodeled, with nice tile and fixtures throughout. Towels are fluffy, linens are plush, and windows had blackout drapes plus nice sheers layered over them. It was a plus to have the refrigerator and microwave, because Whole Foods is just around the corner and I made a couple of grocery runs for late evening and early morning snacks. It appears the entire hotel is being upgraded, including the lobby, which they are in the process of remodeling and should be completed soon. This did not interfere with my comings and goings. In addition, if needed, there is a computer with a printer in the lobby to print your flight reservation or check emails. The location was perfect. I like to walk, and I was able to walk to the Space Needle, all throughout downtown and Pike Place Market several times during my stay. If you don’t care to walk, you can catch the bus routes, which are very close to the hotel; just ask the staff where you would like to go. My compliments to all the staff at this location; they go above and beyond for you. You won’t find a better hotel for the location, price, cleanliness, comfort and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: jstjohn
Reviews.Content: We arrived late after a 6 hr. drive and were pleasantly surprised with the warm welcome at the desk--and the beautiful suite that awaited us. Looks like the rooms and suites have been totally remodeled and upgraded--subtle colors, warm, rich appointments, and stunning city view. The lobby and breakfast room were in the remodel process with workers on ladders and in the hallway. Soon that area will match the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SAndi16
Reviews.Content: We spent there a girls weekend and we were really happy with this hotel! It is close to the space needl and downtown! The rooms were really big and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't think of a nicer place to hang out, great location.”
Reviews.Author: wabeachbum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Downtown for only one night but we arrived around 11.00am and though our room wasn't ready Marisol at the reception managed to find a room that was ready straight away. This was a great relief as my husband wasn't well and we'd been up since 5.00 to catch the train down from Vancouver. When we got to our room we couldn't believe the size. The bathroom and powder room area were close to the entry and then the bedroom was separate. It was such a nice room, the bed was incredibly comfortable. Though we tried to make the most of our short time in Seattle we ended up spending the night in our room, which was so nice to be in. Little extra touches such as the free water and popcorn, as well as the in room microwave were great. We got dinner from Wholefoods around the corner, heat it up in the microwave and spent the night in bed watching TV. It was lovely. Breakfast was more extensive than most of the hotels I have been to in the US with waffle maker, porridge, cereal, pastries, strudel, juice and selection of teas. Reception were extremely helpful with ideas and even offered ideas about other destinations we were travelling to. Great location, only a 10 minute walk to the Space Needle or Pike Place Markets. Fitness room is pretty basic, but did the job. All in all I would be very happy to return to La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: avalon20013
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 days in January. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but the inside in amazing. The lobby and breakfast area is gorgeous. The rooms are big and nice looking, great value for what you pay. Also the staff is very friendly. My only issue is the parking, there aren't a lot of spaces and the spaces are quite snug. Still when we come back to Seattle we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent customer service”
Reviews.Author: SueInManzanita
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice in the last month as part of a group and the woman that works in the morning has been rude to several of us on more than one occasion. We will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Westin than a La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: WorldKimbo
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at a La Quinta in years, so I was pleasantly surprised to see one so plush. The bedding was extra cushy and cosy, it had a double-head shower, a new flat-screen TV and everything looked new or newly renovated. The breakfast was pretty standard for a hotel, but better than most. Had three kinds of coffee (although none that great), waffles, biscuits and gravy, breakfast burritos and all the other standard fare you'd expect. We were even successful in negotiating the price down, even though it was the week of Christmas and they really didn't have to. I was even impressed by their recycling efforts and delighted to see a Whole Foods right behind the hotel. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking was a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Passions P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta in Seattle for three nights. One of the reasons we booked this hotel was because it offered free parking in a secure garage with surveillance cameras... but that turned out to be a total nightmare! On the second night of our stay, someone hit our rental car which was parked in the hotel's garage and left a huge dent. When we asked the front desk to see the footage from the surveillance cameras, we were told that the cameras only face the entrance, exit, and elevator, NOT THE CARS, so we were not able to identify the person who damaged our car. On the third night, we weren't even able to park in the garage because it was completely full (they have very limited parking spaces, a whole lot less than they have rooms), so the front desk told us to park on the street until 10PM then move to the garage that belonged to the restaurant across the street from the hotel. This ended up ruining our plans for the night since we wanted to leave our car at the hotel and take a cab downtown. In addition, on New Years Eve night people were throwing confetti canisters down from their balconies and hitting the cars parked in the handicap spaces below, right in front of the entrance to the hotel. They made loud thumping noises as they hit the cars and one of the canisters almost hit me. We told the front desk about it, and they said, "Yeah, we know. We just got a call about it." I doubt the hotel did anything about it cause those same people continued doing it all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosie222Nanaimo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! Very friendly front desk, friendly to our pet and the hotel was clean the beds were really really comfy. Nice pillows and duvets! Was not expecting the hotel to be this nice with such a reasonable price and probably the only downtown hotel with free parking. Went to a Seahawks game and used the public transport to get to and from the game and it was free too! Can't say anything bad and would use this hotel again and again when we travel to Seattle. For pet owners there is a doggie park just around the corner and a nice park right beside it if you would rather keep your dog on leash and just go for a nice stroll. We walked around downtown at night with our pet and it was very clean and we felt very safe. Nice clean city had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Not much to look at, but a really well-run place”
Reviews.Author: lawgod
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Seattle for a couple of nights after a trip to Vancouver, but it was right around the same time as a Seahawks game, so all the better hotels were booked up or charging a fortune, so we opted for the LaQuinta. First off, the location is quite good. It's much closer to downtown then it looks on the map. Maybe a 15 minute walk to the Pikes Place market - and it's a nice walk as long as you avoid one or two shady blocks nearby (namely the one with the strip club on it). The Space Needle was even closer. The hotel is right off the highway and easy to find. There is an amazing Whole Foods right nearby and since you'll have a fridge in your suite, you can pick up some snacks and stuff to keep in the room. Lots of freebies with the stay - free parking (covered), free wifi, free movies on demand (limited), free breakfast (with hot stuff like eggs and waffles), free afternoon cookies, and free fun time with the puffer fish in the lobby. We were staying with a baby and they had a crib in the room waiting for us. Rooms were big and clean. The staff was nice and helpful. We were really happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service ever experience"”
Reviews.Author: karlaf30
Reviews.Content: amazing customer service, strongly recomend this hotel recently updated from top to bottom office manager upgraded us to a suite without asking what else can we ask for!!! will defently stay here again and again. No swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Evsav
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommend staying @ this comfortable, upgraded and very hospitable La Quinta. The room was totally up to date,beautifully furnished with all the comforts of home. The view of the Space Needle was a PLUS! You can walk to the free downtown buses that take you all over the city. We enjoyed walking & the bus ride to Pikes Place, the Ferry Terminal, S.A.M. museum, the salmon locks. Don't leave out seeing the Chihuly (spelling) Glass Museum in Tacoma. It's awesome! Riding the 'Ducks" is a special treat. You can dine at a neighborhood Korean restaurant or turn the block and ...there's Whole Foods where you can dine in or carry out delicious food. We dined at the seafood/continental restaurant upstairs outside of WFoods. Highly recommend it. We had a blast at ZinZanni Theatro. It was a combo of Parisian Oh LaLa, Cirque d' Soleil style with lots of laughs and acrobatics, singing and dancing. It's pricey, but you can search for a deal on the net. The dinner was good. Have a terrific time, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, value, and very nice room!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli K
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, value, and very nice room! We stayed here before a cruise to Alaska with Celebrity Cruises. I found this on Kayak and was nervous about the price for the location. After staying there I can say it was a very good decision. The manger was very nice and helpful and the staff was very friendly. The hotel helped us book a town car (which is about the same price of a taxi and it can be scheduled ahead of time) and gave us tips on places to go. We were able to walk to downtown Seattle and visit a ton of bars and resteraunts. It was close to the piers that many cruise ships leave from and to the Space Needle as well. We even walked home at 2:00 AM and it location felt very safe. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone. Its not worth paying the price of the other downtown locations! If you are reading other reviews make sure they are recent because the current manager has taken many steps to improve the rooms and has done an excellent job!

Reviews.Title: “Stumbled upon a gem haha”
Reviews.Author: Cam F
Reviews.Content: So i'm writing this review about a year late, but it was worth remembering. I planned a 3 day trip to seattle with myself and a few friends, and was looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in a good location. I booked through a travel site, and wasn't expecting much more than a place to lay my head. It turned out to be a great place. The staff were very nice and accomodating. One front desk employee was willing to tolerate myself and 3 others in the lobby for a few minutes after our night on the town, and even told us things to do on our next trip. The breakfast was nice (and pretty good coffee always available, IF you aren't coffee'd out already, what with the numerous seattle coffee shops and all) room was clean and spacious, and the location was very good. I will stay here again when I go back, and my only regret is that I took so long to write anything about my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stormy Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: bouncey
Reviews.Content: Due to a mistake from our travel agent, we were did arrive until the day after our booked time. The hotel neglected to call and confirm we were coming and charged us for the room and also charged us premium rate for the second night. Thanks to Dalianes Travel in Eureka CA we were reimbursed by the travel agent. The front desk clerk was a rude twenty something who was more interested in visiting with her friends than our needs. The sales manager tried to rectify our displeasure,but we received no comps our other amenities usually given to dissatisfied guests. We would have booked at the Best Western across the street if we had of known it was there. Rooms were adaquite for business travellers, clean and quiet.No view unless you like skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonio_TXLonnie
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the size and cleanliness of our room. the hotel location was great. Right on the edge of downtown in a quite area, one block from the trolley that takes you to city center(6-8 blocks) or lake Union ( about a mile and a half). In addition nice little touches of hot cookies at front desk for guests at night, and coffee and lemonade all day in lobby. Free parking, rare in downtown Seattle hotels. A overall great value.

Reviews.Title: “Better placed than I thought”
Reviews.Author: powderglut
Reviews.Content: My wife managed to find a great deal on this place for under $100.00 on line. I was not expecting much for that in DT area. But was pleasantly surprised. The front desk folk are very helpful I did a lot of walking from this place and actually was glad for the exercise and learning my way around the DT. Room was roomy and fine. Suggestion: don't leave windows open. Too many distracting sounds during the nite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaRed
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room towards H Street towards Space Needle) per a review on tripadvisor & got room 507-great advice. The room was huge, clean and all the amendities we needed. The employees were great, the breakfast was ok, the location was a 15 min walk to Pike's market. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: TomJ56
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Inn in north downtown is decently located. It sits within walking distance of the Space Needle and about a little more than a mile from Pike Marketplace. We had a double queen room and it was very spacious. The parking is a little limited with a few spaces in the front and an underground facility below. Nonetheless, it was full on an evening return. Didn't find out until I paid parking that arrangements with the restaurant next door to allow parking was made. Downtown Seattle discourages driving with parking fees at most hotels and venues, but buses are free during most daytime hours in the core area. Unfortunately, this hotel sits a few blocks outside that zone. Price-wise decent for general downtown area, about $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: cruellapam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convenient and within walking distance to Pike's Place. Also, a very nice park was right across the street and Whole Foods was a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Frendliest, Staff, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: hiker6
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a cruise, I stayed at This hotel 1 night before and 1 night after cruise. I have never saw a hotel where every staff member at the front desk was this friendly and helpful. These 3 ladies were all equally great at their job, and you could tell they loved their job. If i needed directions , suggestions, they took time to explain in detail. I had arrived back from cruise around 9 am and they stored my luggage and told me we were welcomed to have breakfast,where you could make fresh waffles, cereal, juices, biscuits, gravy. They have a very clean, large breakfast room, with TV. The rooms were large, very clean, modern. Frig and microwave. Balconys.bed was very comfortable, nice sheets.the windows were big, with room darkening shades. Its your choice, bright and light or dark and cozy for sleeping. There is a patio out front with table and chairs with flowers surrounding, i sat out there several times to enjoy the fresh air. It cost $11 from pier 91 to the hotel. We did the pre post tour with " lets tour Seattle" where they dropped us off at the cruise ship, please dont waste your $$ on this cruise, our party of 4 was bored out of our mind. Also , we walked to pikes market, space needle. And there is several pizza pasta restaurants that deliver to this hotel.flat rate for taxi to airport $32 we took a suv from airport, that accomodated 4 with 8 pieces of luggage, it was $90. So your best bet is the taxi,be careful though, i paid $11 in a mini van from ship and sis paid 16 in a prius, that had a hard time getting 4 pieces of luggage in.the price was great and I would certainly stay here again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: NEWyoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Location cant be beat, the stop for the street car is one block away. Space needle and the light rail are all within walking distance as well. Clean rooms. Very friendly staff. Continental breakfast is good. Beautiful lobby. no pool :( but thats okay because we were pretty busy seeing the city. Quite easy getting luggage in and out. Food market two blocks away. We felt very safe during our stay, the grounds/parking area are well lit. We are staying here next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good Property for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before going on an Alaskan Cruise. Great value, clean, friendly, breakfast typical for LaQuinta. Nice neighborhood. Walking park close by. Would recommend for business travelers and anyone needing a place to stay prior to an Alaskan cruise. We could see the Space Needle from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippers3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the LaQuinta Inn in downtown Seattle and the place looked bad from the outside - I decided to check out the room before committing to pay for our reservation. Lobby was very nicely appointed and the room upstairs exceeded our expectation. Interior looks to have been recently renovated and the rooms were very clean. Nice central location - walking distance to Pikes Marketplace and downtown shopping. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but Nice”
Reviews.Author: tmoney1982
Reviews.Content: The location is great as far as getting to downtown, the rooms are nice and clean, and the free parking is a great perk. The only downsides were the breakfast was not that good, and the wireless internet didn't work that well. Despite that, I would definitely consider returning if I travel through Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for mass transit and visiting the city via human power!”
Reviews.Author: JGodon
Reviews.Content: Our young family just spent a long weekend in Seattle and packed in as much as we could manage in three days. The LaQuinta was the perfect location for walking with our wheeled luggage from the Link. (Tip - The Link is the perfect way to travel from the airport to downtown. We spent $8 for one-way tickets for two adults and two children.) The hotel provided a hot breakfast option each morning along with cereal, fruit, juices and a plethora of hot coffee or tea. Complimentary ice water and tea were always available in the lobby as well as a chocolate chip cookie in the evening. A Whole Foods Market is located 1/2 block from the hotel as well as a great Korean/Sushi restaurant next door. The rooms have mini-fridges for leftovers as well as a microwave to warm your food. We loved that the hotel practiced recycling and composting! The beds were incredibly comfortable and we had a perfect view of the Space Needle. This location is twenty minutes walking distance from both the Space Needle and Pikes Place Market. We made it an adventure each trip by taking a different route. Hotel staff arranged our transport to Pier 91 for our Princess Cruise and the total cost was only $20 for the four of us. Hotel staff members were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable price for a downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Trailsign
Reviews.Content: Rates were considerably cheaper than other downtown locations, so we weren't sure what we'd find, but this is a very nice place. Parking is a bit cramped, but otherwise, the rooms were clean and well appointed. Breakfast was self serve style, but everything seemed fresh and clean. Just a few blocks from the Space Needle and all the other sights, we had no trouble exploring by foot. I'd use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently clean, friendly staff, handy to Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: TitoB
Reviews.Content: We stay here once a year for our family's Mariners trip. The staff was helpful and friendly upon check-in. The rooms are clean and fairly sizable for a La Quinta. Proximity to Seattle Center and downtown makes this location very handy for many different activities. It is also less pricey than other hotels in the downtown area (although certainly not cheap). There's free parking, but you have to be fairly crafty behind the wheel to squeeze into a few of the spots. Skip the breakfast if you want something other than packaged cereal or oatmenl, mediocre baked goods and foul coffee. Overall, a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Saved us from a night in the car!”
Reviews.Author: Mar5hall
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to praise this hotel enough. My partner and I had been driving around Seattle for nearly 2 hours to try and find a hotel that actually had availability and was affordable. Not sure what was going on the weekend we were there, but nearly everything was sold out. We finally stumbled upon this hotel at the end of our rope and thankfully I got in before 2 other couples that were right behind us. There was one room left and I got it. He didn't over charge me either. I think I paid around $119 including parking and continental breakfast which really helped us out because we were not planning on staying the night. Everywhere else in the area was at least $169 or more. The suite was very large and had kitchenette facilities. It was clean and the bed, comfortable. Location wise, was pretty good and not too far from city center. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a night or two in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Pippi011
Reviews.Content: Good value, the rooms are fine though nothing special, beds comfortable and the hotel is very clean. It is walkable distance (if you like to walk) from the Westlake light rail stop from Sea-TAC (the cheap and convenient way to get to/from the airport), Space Needle, waterfront and the Market. The area seemed remote but safe. Have no complaints as it was good for what we needed - a day before a cruise so that we could get to the ship on time but also see some of the sights. Hurricane Grill was nearby - a dive hamburger rock and roll place that had good burgers, the Whole Foods Market salad and food bars and the Walgreens, Columbia and Nordstrom Rack stores for last minute purchases. Prices varied depending on when you looked at the web sites but we got a decent rate given that the location in downtown, which is suprisingly pricey anyways.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: luckygreen
Reviews.Content: First of all I must confess that this is the only hotel I’ve ever stayed at in Seattle. I am not equipped to make comparisons. That being said, I was traveling with my two sisters and our elderly mother. Mom’s ability to ambulate varies depending on the day and how much she’s been on her feet. By the end of the day she is very unsteady and uses walking sticks. We brought along her handicap placard just for that reason and to make the trip as easy on her as possible. We popped back into the hotel one lunch time to regroup before heading back out. All of the handicap places in front were taken; one by the hotel manager (who is not – by the way – disabled). That was irritating but perhaps she just needed to grab something quick? At the end of the day when we returned, the manager’s car was still parked in one of the two handicap places in front of the hotel. When I went in to inquire, Mirasol (a sweet, helpful receptionist) said that the car would be moved right away. We parked illegally in the street waiting. After a few more minutes my sister ran in to see when “right away” would be. After quick discussion, Mirasol offered to move the manager’s car for her; which she did; although we were advised we could park in the parking garage instead. After parking and getting Mom in the hotel, I asked to speak to the manager who was not at all apologetic, but a bit testy stating that there were no parking spaces when she’d come to work at 7:00 a.m. Apparently, she’d parked there for the entire day. By profession I am an advocate for elderly and disabled persons. This sat very poorly with me. While parking was indeed free, the spaces in the garage that we did use the next day were extremely narrow and judging by the marred walls, we were not the only ones challenged to pull in and out. The hotel rooms were nice; equipped with a microwave and fridge. Breakfast was okay. Best feature was that the Whole Foods store was only a block away and we food some very good eating bargains there. Our last night at the hotel we shared the hallway with very rowdy young men running back and forth from two rooms; yelling, letting the doors slam, etc. The evening manager had already warned them and warned them again after we called. They quieted until about 2:30 a.m. when they started up again. I do believe the staff would have had them removed had I called again, but I figured that would be an even noisier proposal so I just tried to sleep through it as best as possible. My companions had earplugs. So in summary; decent hotel, good location, free but tricky parking, excellent front desk staff, not-so-excellent manager, okay breakfast, and great Whole Foods nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BamaNana
Reviews.Content: We had no problems of any type with the LaQuinta onn 8th Ave. After reading reviews here I was concerned but in no way did the service, room, or location disappoint us. The walk to Pike Place Market was about 20 mins and we walk s l o w. Walking to the Space Needle took about the same time. The staff was friendly and helpful . Breakfast was, assorted cold cereals, hot oatmeal, waffles, boiled eggs, breakfast burrito, toast etc. The normal variety of quick food for motels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelmanager33027
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I stayed here before and after my Alaskan cruise. It was a short taxi cab ride to the port and a short walk to shopping and the Space Needle. The first night I arrived, I didn't get to the hotel until almost midnight, but they were super friendly and were waiting for my arrival. The room was very clean, the beds super comfortable and plenty of room. if I wanted to go out, I called the front desk and asked them to order me a taxi and a few minutes later they would call my room and tell me the taxi was waiting. i arrived back to the hotel after my cruise about 9:00AM and couldn't check in because the hotel was sold out. They kept all of our luggage secure and we took off on foot to explore the city. Hotel was great! Staff very friendly and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: Emma509
Reviews.Content: I was extremly impressed with the location, price, and over all expereince. The rooms was recenty updated. Everything was new and clean. The beds were comfortable. The location is walking distance from downtown. There is onsite parking, which is a bonus. Very happy with the overall and will stay there agian for sure.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: HHTAP
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, reasonable rates including free parking and breakfast. Room was recently updated. Very comfortable king bed. New bathroom fixtures including countertops. Clean. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast included coffee, juice, bread (white and whole wheat), bagels, biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, yogart, cold cereals and waffles.Good area of the city with several restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: shaaley
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here for a couple nights a while ago, as we were trying to find her a wedding dress. For just a couple nights, we were needing anything fancy.And this hotel surely isn't. But it served it's purpose (we booked for cost and location). The good: Our room was very large! Everything seemed to be in good working order. Didn't see anything in terms of cleanliness that grossed us out. Mini fridge and microwave was great. It was quiet. Check in/check out was a breeze. Great location - a couple blocks or so from the downtown core. The Not so Good: I am extremely allergic to feathers. So feather pillows and/or duvets will trigger an asthma attack. When we called down to get synthetic pillow sent up, they said they didn't have any? What?? Surely, it's not such an odd request for a hotel, is it? So I had to sleep on a folded up sweatshirt. Not great. The hotel is starting to show it's age..the room had wear and tear. Again, not a huge deal,but they might want to consider updating the rooms a bit, if they haven't done so by now. The "buffet" breakfast: the breakfast room looked like a small high school cafteria (Actually my high school cafeteria looked nicer than this!). And it's self serve, so you have to make your own waffles! Okay, well t least they make the batter for you, and it's easy enough to pour it into the waffle maker. So not a huge deal (you get what you pay for). The kids seemed to enjoy making their waffles! Other than that, there was just some yogurt and fruit and cereal. We didn't see any staff member even come in and check on supplies or see if any tables needed clearing or anything. We really were on our own! That being said, everyone there was well behaved and cleaned up after themselves. (I gotta say, I was impressed by the overall friendliness of our neighbours to the south. Received a lot of smiles and thank you's and excuse me's and sorry's if someone accidently bumped in to you. My hometown, Vancouver, has seemed to have lost that over the past 15 years. It's rare that I get a thank you for holding the door open for someone!) So kudos to the people of Seattle! And I shall return to take advantage of your shopping in the future. I would stay again at this hotel, if just for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly unexpected!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravelallover
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel definitely is not representative of the outside. Although the murals on the walls of the hotel are beautiful, the rest of the outside of the hotel does not present well. The lobby is definitely dated, but in the middle of a renovation, so that is good. I was very surprised,therefore, when we walked into this totally transformed suite!!!Very contemporary room! 2 Tv's, double sinks, micro and fridge as well as comfortable pull-out sofa, granite countertops and double showerhead! Also, because we stay at Laquinta so often, they gave us an upgrade for the same price. The king bed and pillows were almost heaven. Slept extremely well and did not hear a thing in the middle of a big city! Room 307 has 2 views of the Seattle Needle from the windows. Only drawback was virtually no place for dog to run without walking almost 2 blocks to Denny Park(with the homeless in tow). We did not have a problem, but city life is definitely not "living at the beach". (Long Beach, WA).

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gpwhisperer
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit skeptical but took the chance anyway. We had a great experience! The front desk staff were helpful and friendly, the room, although a bit worn, was clean and comfortable. The hotel does allow pets and Denny Park is about a block away. There are also some handy spots right in front of the hotel. Just make sure you bring your own baggies to clean up after your pet. It's a mile or so walk to the Market, but the streets are pedestrian friendly. Breakfast was the usual- waffles, muffins, yogurt, cereal. Hotel is under renovation right now, but we were not inconvenienced by noise, workmen, etc. Free parking was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: raesive
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much nicer than what I was expecting when I heard the name, so I was pleasantly surprised with the room upon check-in. The only downside was that they were remodeling at the time, and it got very noisy the next morning when we were packing up. Thankfully we hadn't planned to sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “When traveling is stressful....”
Reviews.Author: alaska99712
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a liver transport patient when we moved hotels and stayed at the La Quinta on International in Seattle. It was a very stressful time. I was 2500 miles from home with no support system, dealing with someone who did not feel good, a stressful transportation situation, little sleep, little food. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. They were very supportive asking me if they could help in any way. Any assistance that I needed they were there or found the assistance that was best for my client and myself. They were ALWAYS cheerful and were sincere in the inquiries and offers of assistance. We are back in December and it is not near as stressful thanks to the staff. I will ALWAYS stay at the LaQuinta when I travel with my client, other clients or by myself. The hotel was clean, breakfast was fresh and plentiful, and the facilities clean and user friendly. The beds were so comfortable that I could fall asleep even when I couldn't stop my minds activity. Kudos to the staff and many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “pretty darn good stay”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently as we were attending a show at the paramount theater. Check in was a breeze and the front desk were very friendly. I was also pleasantly surprised with our room. I thought, since we had a room with one queen bed, that it would be small, but the bathroom area was nice and spacious, we had a small couch and a patio. The complimentary microwave popcorn, water and coffee in room was a nice little touch too. The view from our patio wasn't much to look at, an old building with ugly curtains, but not a big deal for me. We walked downtown to the paramount among many other places and location was great for that (was about a 10-15min walk to Pike St). We returned to the hotel by taxi cab and it was cheap (about $6!). The free parking is quite cramped and very limited, we were lucky to get a spot although, we did arrive early, so I would recommend that, if possible. For the price I paid, I have to say that I was pleased with our stay. If your just coming into town for a show or sports event, I would totally recommend this hotel, however, if youv'e never been to Seattle before, I would stay somewhere closer in to the center of town with a nicer view and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable. Could have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: ste1070
Reviews.Content: Generally a good standard. Noticed a few cleanliness issues which would have been simply resolved with a wipe of a cloth so I think cleaning regime needs reviewing. My Wife notice a stick sugary stain on a table outside of elevator and it was there for the 2 nights we stayed i.e. no cloth run over this common area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SherW24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the space needle, and not too far from the Pike Place Market and has reasonable (for Seattle) rates. While the hotel could use some work, the staff is pleasant and helpful, and the beds are super comfortable. This alone goes a long way to making me happy. We stayed pre and post cruise with them, and were satisfied with the choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out, needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Merlot2010
Reviews.Content: The curtains fell off the wall the 1st night while we were sleeping which is s problem with an office building directly behind us. The phone didn't work. The air conditioning barely worked. The worst thing was that the bottom of the bathtub "squished". I can only imagine the amount of mold under the tub!! On top of that, a guest pulled the fire alarm and we were visited by the local and professional fire fighters at 3:00 AM. Without a car, you will do a lot of walking since the location is closest to but several blocks away from the Space Needle, shopping and public transportation. The best thing - it was a block from Whole Foods. The staff was friendly but powerless to do much about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta's Cory”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler852
Reviews.Content: At 6AM in the morning, a violent and insistent phone ringing woke me up. I jumped out of bed to answer it, dreading some kind of horrible urgent news, only it was a pleasant recording informing me that this is my wakeup call. But we had not requested one. “What's going on?” my husband's sleepy voice asked. And our two young children began to roll in their bed, and rubbing their eyes. So I dialed the front desk to find out. “Your wake up call service just called our room at six, except we didn't request this wakeup call!” I announced the complain in my most irritated quiet voice. “....I didn't do it.” the voice on the other end said. What kind of answer is this?! I found out that the voice belongs to Aldrich. “Well, who did?” I had to go along. “...let's see...the person before my shift...could be Cory,” Aldrich. This surprised me even more that his first reply. I had not expected Aldrich to actually produce a prime suspect for me. It is too early to keep this going. “Actually, I don't care if it is you or Cory, don't you think you should apologize to me?” I opted to suggest the most entry level customer service etiquette to Aldrich. “Would you like to speak with my manager?” Aldrich asked me. “Why?” wondering why he didn't just issue me an apology. “Because you sound upset,” Aldrich dryly stated his reason. I declined Aldrich's invitation. Because I much rather go back to sleep. At 9AM, I decided to see if another hotel representative might like to apologize to me. Marisol was equally unapologetic, plus a tense and defensive face, minus the humor that Aldrich unwittingly indulged. The conversation with Marisol mostly consisted with a series of possible excuses to explain how none of this is anyone's fault. The most interesting excuse is that their wake up call system will sometimes just randomly call and wake guests up. Marisol assured me that it only happens about once every 3 months, plus the one time, when their phone system kept call this one room everyday for no reason. She said they are machines, so mistakes can happen with machines. Actually, by this point, I had my own suspect in mind. If it is intentional, it had to be the person that checked me in the previous day. I think her name is Yesenia. We wanted to check in early, and was told the room would be ready by 1:45PM. Well, we didn't check in until a little after 3PM. Yesenia reminds me of someone who has been in the service industry for too long, and is so jaded, that she harbors a disdain for anyone walking around with luggages. She was unfriendly and rude. As I finally got my room card key, I couldn't hold it in anymore, and I told her that she could be nicer. Later that evening, my husband picked up the phone and called the front desk, and requested a 9AM wake up call. We did this just to avoid another potential 6AM call. Their menacing wake up call rang our room again at 6AM! I kid you not! FURIOUS!! MAD!! I dialed the front desk again. Somehow my furor toned down a bit when I heard Aldrich's voice on the other end again. He needed to be dealt in a different way. “Aldrich, Cory woke us up again.” I informed Aldrich. At least this time, he came up with a slightly more appropriate response. “OH NO!” Aldrich. I asked Aldrich to tell his hotel management about this and went back to bed. Later that day, we left at 11AM, and came back to our room a little after 5PM. Our room had not been cleaned. So we called the front desk to request our room cleaned and for new towels. They told us that housekeeping has left for the day. We were excited that we were leaving this hotel the next day at 5:30AM for an early morning flight. If you are someone who like to pay $185 a night (tax included) for a small and outdated room, managed by 3rd world country motel operators, then this place is a special heaven for you. But I still urge you to not stay in room #603, because this is the room that their wakeup call machine likes to call for no reason. La Quinta should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: nurse02818
Reviews.Content: When planning this stay in Seattle ,I counted on my Trip Advisor colleagues to find a reasonable place to stay . Of all the hotels in my price range , La Quinta received the most positive reviews and so I chose it . The hotel is within walking distance of downtown so we were able to squeeze a lot into our 2 nite stay . The room was clean and quiet . The desk staff were accomodating when we arrived early and left late . We were able to store our luggage and make use of every minute in Seattle. When we arrived I asked if there was a pay phone nearby so I could call my family . The desk clerk insisted I use their phone as there were no public phones handy.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: anniebanannie79
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here when we were recently in Seattle while I stayed down the street at the Holiday Inn. I was so glad that I didn't have to sleep here. This La Quinta was the worst one I've ever been in. It hasn't been renovated like a lot of La Quintas recently have. It was dirty and run-down, with carpet I wouldn't stand on barefoot, stains on the bedding, and yucky substances on the walls. Yes, it's a good price, but that doesn't make it a good value. The Holiday Inn in basically the same neighborhood was actually a few dollars less expensive but was about a million times better.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We are on an around the country road trip with our dog so we've stayed in lots of places recently. La Quinta's are often our first choice because of their pet-friendly policies. In Seattle we wanted to stay near downtown and thought we'd probably book a different hotel since the La Quintas we've stayed in tend to be not in downtown areas. But this one has a good downtown location. It's possible to walk to many places of interest from the hotel. One of the biggest bonuses is free parking. Every other hotel I checked had at least a $35 a day parking fee. Another bonus is the very friendly and helpful staff. They even gave our pup a treat bag. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which had a nice view of downtown and the Space Needle. The living room area was spacious but the bedroom was small. This was not a problem because of the spaciousness of the other room plus there was a pretty decent closet. The largest negative to this suite is that there is no air conditioning unit in the bedroom-there is just a small fan on the dresser--the only a/c unit is in the living room. It wasn't a big problem for us because the weather was not too hot, but in hot weather this could be a problem. The bathroom was small and could use some updating--the tub floor had a crack in it. But everything was very clean and the bed linens and towels were fine. There was a little bar area in the hallway with a sink, microwave and coffee maker. The free breakfast was pretty standard La Quinta fare but was fine. With a good price, the location, and the nice staff we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: keepitnice
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other La Quinta and they are decent. But his one MUST find a new cleaning company and manager. I cannot believe they allow the rooms to remain so filthy - WOW. The walls, especially in the bathroom - well, I don't know if they have ever been wiped down never mind cleaned. They literally had some sort of fluid spills on them and lots of I guess grime. My shower was so nasty, that too hadn't been cleaned...ever? The hook for my towel was barely being held on by the one remaining screw. The bedroom and shower curtains also had some sort of ..fluid or food on them. And the headboard to my bed >> I kept my feet at that end because I couldn't have my head near it. You don't even want to know about the carpet or my stained linens - do you? Does the management ever look in the rooms to see what type of job the cleaning service is doing? They aren't cleaning for sure. I truly wouldn't be surprised if a cleaning service like that does NOT change out the sheets or towels. One the good side, they have a nice fish tank in the lobby. This is hotel was filthy, I would recommend not staying here unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joel1316
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the La Quinta for 5 nights. Most attractions are within walking distance of about .5 – 1 mile away. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to Pike’s Place Market. The complimentary breakfast was great. My son loved making waffles to start out his day. It’s not a fancy place to stay, but for the price, it was worth the money. The staff was friendly; the room was clean and close to everything (including a Whole Foods Market that was around the corner). I would definitely recommend this hotel to other budget minded travelers like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: mkstach
Reviews.Content: Location is close to major attractions. We got great service when making our reservations and things got better after we arrived. You should know parking is at a premium and to ask for a space when making reservations. Right now there is no extra charge for parking here but that could change at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: junglecat64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights from Tuesday Feb 9th. Got a great rate and I slept like a log. The toilet seats bolts were very loose and they sent somebody up right away to fix it - they ended up replacing the whole seat. This is exactly the kind of place I want when I am on the road myself: good beds, quiet, decent breakfast and helpful staff. Can't ask for more. In fact, when my wife and kids and I return in the summer, we will probably stay here. You can walk to the space needle and take the monorail to Pioneer Square from there, or you can walk all the way. I did the latter. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: emitchel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here specifically because of the price and because of the pet-friendly quality. It was our first time traveling with this particular small dog, and we are very impressed. Staff loved him, and even offered to babysit him while we attended our concert, if he was too lonely while we were gone. The room was spacious and while the view was of the building next door, there was a small balcony, and we could see to the cross street. Noise control was pretty good--we were on the 6th floor, and so that helped. The king-size bed was so comfortable, with plenty of pillows; there were plenty of towels, and a roomy dressing area just outside the bathroom/shower/tub. We will definitely stay here again. We loved how close this (as far as walking distance) was to everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “My Room Door Was Open When I Returned.....”
Reviews.Author: happymcmartin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 2 nights. First of all, check in was slow. Location is ok, but kind of hard to find. Room was very basic and not the most comfy room. When I checked in, the front desk clerk handed me all of my info, room keys etc. all together and did not say anything about a parking pass. Upon the next day, I was leaving for the day, and found my parking pass!! It stated, place in dash or car will be towed. Well, if it was towed, I would not have been happy. It was not thank goodness! Now, when I returned late at night, I got to my room only to discover that my door was half way open!!! I quickly went in and made sure everything was there and I think it was. I rushed down to the front desk, and she said " Houskeeping must have not closed the door all the way, I will let them know" There was no concern at all! Overall, I will not return!

Reviews.Title: “Better Service and Amenities than Hilton”
Reviews.Author: IsagenixBeliever
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton in Portland, OR a few weeks ago and didn't have a comfortable and convenient accommodations as I do here. I LOVE it. HUGE rooms, great staff and walking distance to downtown Seattle. They have FREE hot cookies :-) , FREE parking, FREE exercise room, FREE wifi, FREE Breakfast and more. And $89 a night!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel- great bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: nireshadow
Reviews.Content: clean hotel with excellent location. Room was fantastic with everything needed (including an iron!). 5 min walk to downtown. staff were knowledgeable, friendly and kind with a real dedication to making your stay a success.great breakfast in the morning ( free!) included sausages, yogurt, waffles, toast, sweets, oatmeal, coffee.. the list goes on! parking was free and our vehicle was safe within our site ( didn't want it broken into) Excellent stay and we would come again FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice trip.”
Reviews.Author: spook1048
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed on the 29th of August before leaving on a cruise. The price was very good, the hotel was a little old, but the rooms were VERY clean, and the employees were more than nice. When we got back from the cruise, they even allowed us to store our luggage there while we toured the city waiting for our late airline departure time. The only problem was that transportation to the pier and to the airport can get very expensive. We got with a Towncar driver who was very nice but, by the time we left Seattle after using him about 6 times added up to about $150.00. You just don't realize how much you are spending until you leave and put a pencil to it. Next time, I will use a taxi. Excellent hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice at an Unbeatable Price!”
Reviews.Author: raskolnikova
Reviews.Content: I'd like to know where else you can find a clean hotel with relatively spacious rooms, complimentary breakfasts, free internet at a location halfway between downtown and Seattle Centre!? The front desk staff were friendly and knowledgeable--only too eager to please. In the evenings you get your pick of complimentary freshly baked cookies for god's sake. There is complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7 and the breakfast has something for everyone. Overall, we couldn't have asked for anything more. I'll be sure to come back. Thank you to the staff at "La Quinta Inn" downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WannabeTravelMum
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, only stayed one night ... maybe my previous La Quinta experience (Flagstaff AZ) was a particularly good one, but this place was quite a dump. We arrived late at night and our 1-bdrm suite reeked of stale cigarette smoke; the room was very worn / run-down - particularly the bathroom (which was also tiny). The free breakfast was also pretty basic - no fruit / yoghurt or much in the way of healthy options. However, the night-time receptionist when we arrived was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pkrjp8381
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for a weekend get-away and stayed at La Quinta in downtown Seattle. This is not a luxury hotel. if you need a clean room with a clean bed and bathroom, this is a great place to stay for the price. The location is fantastic very near the I-5 and all the downtown sites. Keep in mind, I am not a traveler that needs a five star hotel to enjoy a vacation. I only use hotels for a clean bed, a place to relax, and a hot shower. If you are the type that likes to stay in upscale places with all of the amenities, this is not the place for you. The free breakfast was good. Keep in mind, it is free so don't expect a gourmet meal. But it is better than spending money on a breakfast you will forget by tomorrow. They had the typical La Quinta items -- cold cereal, waffles, biscuits & gravy, fruit, yogurt bagels, toast, etc. There were a few negatives, although minor in my opinion. First, the elevators are slow. We quit waiting for them and just used the stairs. Also, the free parking was tight as the hotel seemed full. We had to really squeeze into some spots. However, I don't blame the hotel, but other patrons who didn't know how to park between the lines. They would instead take two stalls to park. Also, the hotel is old and appears to be a purchased property that was converted into La Quinta. But I feel that they have done a great job of remodeling the building to make it very pleasant considering the age of the building. Another great thing is the business/internet center where you could use the internet and print for free. Most of the "upscale" hotels charge for this service, yet La Quinta allows it for free. The main thing about La Quinta that I always find is consistency. I am always treated well by the staff and I always get what I am looking for: A clean, comfortable room at a good price. That is all I am looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: hrich324
Reviews.Content: We were cruising out of Seattle in June. We booked a night before and after the cruise. The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable. Location was good. In walking distance of the Space Needle. The breakfast was average at best. It came with the room. The staff was very friendly. Be careful about letting the staff make reservation for you. They book dinner for us on the Space Needle and my wife was very unhappy that we didn't get a window seating. We were never asked where we wanted to sit. The one thing that really made me mad was the car service that the hotel recommended over charged us going to the cruise. We were not sure of the port and got the price for wrong port from the desk. Not knowing we had been taken advantage of we call the same people to pick us up, and were told it was a flat rate $20 less than we were changed before. I talked to the hotel manager and he was no help at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Old . . . NOT Top-Tier!”
Reviews.Author: amityeric
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at lots of La Quintas. We've been saving up our points for...well, for whenever we needed a free night. Our cousins were coming into Seattle for a night or two so we decided to head to Seattle to visit them. We checked to see if we had enough points for a free night in one of the La Quinta properties. Well, we had enough to stay in Federal Way (which is a very clean, very nice, newer property), but not quite enough to stay in the top-tier hotel in downtown Seattle. So, we decided to pay extra to stay in the downtown Seattle location and we prepared for a very nice stay. First, the location of the hotel is not good. There's a lot of construction going on around it so it's loud. Also, it's a bit away from the busy section of downtown and it's a bit quiet and creepy at night. Second, there's very little parking so if you want to park...get there early and don't give up your spot. Third, there's only ONE person helping downstairs (a very nice person) but if there are people there you have to wait forever for service. Fourth, the rooms are small. I mean SMALL (at least the non-suite rooms). Fifth, the building is old. The walls are beat up, paint is flaking, etc. Sixth, the floors are dirty. Our socks were brown on the bottoms after walking on the carpet just a little bit (we only stayed one night and weren't there much). Seventh, and most important of all, is that the rooms STINK TO HIGH HEAVEN! I couldn't believe how bad the smell was. I immediately went to the front desk and asked to be removed from my room because of the scent. It was like someone had dumped five gallons of cleaning chemical into the carpet or onto the bed or something. Honestly, the smell was overwhelming. I was ready to check out right then if they didn't move me to another room. They did upgrade me to a suite, which was a good size, but the same issues existed there. The smell was still horrendous (and it didn't fade even though I left the windows open the entire Saturday afternoon while we were out enjoying Seattle). The paint was chipping, the carpets were horribly dirty, and everything was just a bit bottom-tier. I am used to decent (not fancy) hotel rooms and this one did not meet standard in any way. Breakfast was good, the one person up front was nice, the room size (for a suite) was good, but everything else - horrible. Please read this and understand - I normally like the La Quinta. This one, though, doesn't belong in the La Quinta chain.

Reviews.Title: “Left after one night!”
Reviews.Author: mimi_bird
Reviews.Content: I usually have great experiences at La Quintas but have learned now to avoid properties that are not newly built but were taken over by this chain. In general La Quinta Inns have fresh decor, spacious rooms and nice facilities at a reasonable price. However this one had bland, depressing decor, unattractive furnishings, cramped bath with no counter or shelf, moldy odor in room, bad directions given by desk staff, no parking, room looking straight into a buildiing under construction. I shortened my stay here and moved to a B&B for my second night. The parking lot was a miniscule square with no outlet so once I turned the corner and found there were no spaces left, I had to BACK my car all the way out! Had to park around the block and walk back in the rain. The price $143 a night was not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: gabbygigi
Reviews.Content: The location allows good access to Seattle sights. Arriving late in the evening, all parking garage places were taken but the front desk kindly arranged for parking at the hotel across the street. We were pleasantly surprised that the 2 room suite was huge. Fridge, micro, sink, popcorn, bottled water were all pluses. The unit was very clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds we had ever experienced- very welcome after a long flight. Breakfast was nicely presented with do-it-yourself waffles. Staff was pleasant and friendly, as was everyone we encountered in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Blue24g
Reviews.Content: For the price of 150$ for 4 people, this Hotel turned out to be great. The rooms were very good, big and well equipped with microwave, fridge, coffee maker and even popcorn! The breakfast is very generous, there is a hot tub and a nice internet workstation (with a printer, which could be very handy), and staff was very helpful (we asked for a room in the front and not in the construction side). Overall - Great value and a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: LOLSFlorida
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews we were confused as to what we would find once we arrived. We decided to stick to our reservations because of the price and on average all the reviews were good with only a few exceptions. We stayed at this location as a pre-cruise stay to take in the sites at seattle. We also datyed there for one night post cruise and it was a great exp as well. When we arrived at the property, I was pleasently surprised with the location as the bldg itself;some of the pictures do not do it justice. The lobby area was very nicely decorated, clean, and nice to walk into. The staff was awesome, and since our room was available we were able to check in sooner. When we got to our room, we had a King suite and it was awesome. We requested the non-construction side since we had read some of the reviews. Our room faced the city and we could see the Space Needle from our room. The room was like a small apartment. We had a sink, microwave and fridge. The room was separate from the living room. Some one had writtten that the beds were the best beds that they had slept on, and we agree. The beds and pillows were awesome. It was the best beds we had ever slept on in any hotel. The hallways were very clean, room smelled nice as well. My parents stayed in another room and they had a balcony room that faced the city and it was awesome as well. Our main concern when staying in a hotel is cleanliness, beds and overall look of the room. This location had it all as far as we are concerned, and we are an extremely picky group when it comes to hotel stays. The breakfast area and what they offered was awesome as well.They had waffles that you could make and they had on some of the days biscuits and gravy. The location was in walking distance to alot of the locations. And if you wanted to visit the waterfront its was like 8 dollar cab ride. They now are adding 2.00 to each of the fares for gas, but even so for us it was 5.00 a couple. They are right next door to 2 car rental places where you could rent a car if you wanted too. Overall this hotel was better than expected and we were very pleased on the nice stay that we had there. Those that wrote a 'bit creepy' and the worst stay might have expierenced having bad rooms or the const side, but for us it was great.

Reviews.Title: “a bit creepy”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the parking is VERY tight, and the construction was a bit noisy. We had a room facing the construction. The front desk staff said the construction noise would start around 9am, but of course it started much earlier. We were up early so it didn't wake us. There was limited parking right outside the front door, with the majority of parking under the hotel (I hate underground parking). We had to go through a construction zone to get to that camera-secured parking area, and then once parked we took the elevator directly to our floor. The elevators and elevator doors were jerky, and didn't always stop even with the floor. One day, my husband was checking the tires on our vehicle, and a maintenance guy came out to see what he was doing- basically making sure he wasn't doing anything illegal. This made me feel better knowing they were actually watching and following up on any "suspicious" activity. Housekeeping left something to be desired. After the first night (we stayed two), they took the soap and didn't leave any replacements. We didn't have enough towels, so called the desk for some to be sent up but they never came so we had to go get them. The hotel is directly across from a motel with "questionable" clientele - it made me a bit uncomfortable walking by, especially with small kids. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to the Seattle Center, which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: justice19985
Reviews.Content: The pictures they show you on the web site must be their top of the line rooms because the rooms they gave us where run done and in need of repair. The pipes vibrated when you ran the shower and sounded like they were going to come out of the wall. Also don't let them call you a cab because they are in with cab companies and will drop you off at the wrong locations. Forget about speeking to a manager beacause there never seems to be one on duty and if they are they just don't care about returning your calls. Next time I would pay a little more and get a hotel down by the water it seems it would be worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: BBMT
Reviews.Content: Found this place on line, after weeks of searching hotels in downtown that weren't $450. We were so pleased! Especially loving their 1 pm check out time. Great beds, nice leather recliner--tv was smaller. Pet friendly. There was construction next door, but it did not disturb our sleep at all in the early morning. There are 10 parking spots right by the door if you are lucky enough to score one--tight squeeze for our SUV. The regular parking lot is around the block, and it was blocked by a truck--so they let us park right outside the door, until the truck left. Nice shower, pet friendly-- quick jaunt to the market, downtown, art museum, and Dick's drive in on Capitol HIll (which they nicely gave us directions for.) Room was quiet and nice ammenitites.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for parking”
Reviews.Author: kikiane
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is older, but clean. Our room was very large, and even had a seperate bedroom from the living area. The parking is extremely limited and extremely tight. Don't try parking here unless your in an economy size vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: murr55
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel located in the downtown area. My room was very spacious with a fridge and microwave. Rate was much lower than other downtown hotels plus the parking is free. A bit of a walk to some of the tourist areas but nothing is too far away. The free cookies at night are yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view... of a building site”
Reviews.Author: Brightrob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner during our trip to Seattle. We booked our room via the lq.com website. The hotel is centrally located and very close to the city centre... certainly within walking distance. Ideal if you arrive in the city by Greyhound buses. When we arrived in our room, we discovered that it had a view of the building site instead of Seattle. It was quite noisy during the day and building works were staring at approx 8 am. The hotel computer, which was located by the reception desk in the business centre kept on crashing. The hotel serves cookies to its guests at 7 pm... these were lovely. Breakfast was quite simple, but plentiful. Our room was clean and well maintained. Upon checking out we mentioned the problem about the ongoing building works and computer troubles and we received a 50% discount on our stay. Overall quite a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal near downtown”
Reviews.Author: travelernc08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference, which was based at the Convention Center. It was about a ten minute walk to the Center each morning and a $6 or $7 taxi ride back each night (that includes the $2 surcharge for hike in gas prices). Made reservations online for $125 a night and ended up with a suite--fridge, microwave and a balcony. Queen bed with a pull-out couch. Sink outside the bathroom as well as inside. Also, free wireless Internet access. Breakfast came with the stay. Standard hotel breakfast-cereal, yogurt, fruit, pastries, coffee, juice. Also, could make your own waffle. Room was clean and did not notice a smell or siren noises at night. Construction was going on in back of hotel but my room was in front. Only noticed the construction during breakfast. Hotel staff very helpful. Convenient to downtown and waterfront. Did seem a little dated upon entering the hotel but will definitely stay here again if I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: QueenMemphis
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel prior to leaving for our cruise to Alaska. The hotel was clean and neat. The rooms are small, but the bedding is very comfortable, and the bathrooms were spotless. I had read a lot of reviews and was a little nervous. But we did not have any problems with the hotel. It is convenient to everything, and a good price for the area. There was no smell (as others had mentioned), I was not bothered by the construction, and the breakfast suited us just fine. One thing I will note. DO NOT USE THE SHUTTLE SERVICE PROVIDED BY THE HOTEL. We made our reservations in advance, but they did not have enough room for all of us in the van and town car. So, we were stacked on top of each other like sardines. They expected us to pay full price when 2 of us did not have seats. I recommend that you use the standard services as recommended by Seattle tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MLKen
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four adults that stayed here for three nights May 21 - 24. We were so pleased, especially after reading some not-so-positive reviews. Our room had two queen beds. It was clean, a great size and we loved the microwave (popcorn provided), small refrig, and two sinks. All the staff were very pleasant and answered our questions and always asked if there was anything they could do for us. The breakfast was excellent and had a nice variety. We loved the location and easy walk to Seattle Center. Within our first hours there we walked to the Pike Street Market and back without any problem. We appreciated the free parking provided outside and in the garage area. We couldn't have asked for anything better. I'd return in a New York minute and I'm recommending it to anyone I know planning to head out to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: VicGirl
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous after reading the reviews but we believe everything deserves to be tried at least once. We checked in with absolutley no problems. We were directed up to the 4th floor where we opened the door to a king suite. It had a king size bed in the bedroom with a sofa bed in the living room. We had a fridge and a microwave. It was great. The location was convenient and within walking distance to everything we needed. The breakfast was amazing, My son especially enjoyed making me waffles every morning. The home made cookies in the evening were a nice touch. Honestly we just have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Place”
Reviews.Author: radryan
Reviews.Content: In a very walkable area of Seattle, located by Denny Way park. There was considerable noise from police and fire sirens several nights. The bedroom was very small, just enough room to walk around the bed. The living area is nice and roomy. The bathroom was small with no sink counter space. The only mirror in the entire hotel room was above the sink in the bathroom making it hard for two females to get ready in the morning. Loved the breakfast in the morning that is included in the hotel price. Very slow internet.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible: SMELLED, DIRTY, OLD, AND NASTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aaakkkdddccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights it was horrible there was smeared dog crap on the floor, it smelled like [--] in the room, the room was filthy, the bed sheets were hanging out on the floor, the tub had dirt and hair in it, the mirrors were all dirty, the breakfast was out of everything an hour before it was supposed to end and they did not restock it, did not bring us new towels, very poor service!!!! I would not reccomend staying here to anyone, your better off paying more ateast you wont have to pay to park when you actually want to do something its not in walking distance to anything, very bad location.. I wish I would have taken pictures!!! just noticed you can add them.

Reviews.Title: “It Wasn't All Bad!”
Reviews.Author: jlavivong
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay their. They had a small spa area with a sauna, and jacuzzi. They even had a small gym. The location was ok, space needle was just a few blocks away... but it was a little far from everything else! So we walked to where we wanted to go and then took a cab back. The cab ride ranged from $6-$15 from downtown, chinatown, and pioneer square. There's a whole foods market behind the hotel that i really enjoyed. The construction next to the hotel made it a drag when i was trying to sleep in. So ask for a room on the other side of the construction! The rooms were clean, and had a lot more space than i expected. Breakfast was ok, they had the basic muffins, waffles, coffee, and more. I got the this room for $62.50 a night, so i thought the price was great!!! Really didn't have too much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Run like the wind to another location!”
Reviews.Author: economyclass
Reviews.Content: This property is horrible. Room is old and dirty. Furniture worn and in bad repair. NOT up to la quinta standards. Was supposed to stay two nights and checked out after 20 minutes! Please find another location downtown. Lots of choices in this price point.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Worn, but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tulacat
Reviews.Content: Though the building is showing its age, it was a good place to stay. The lobby and halls are a bit beat up, but the room was clean and comfortable and quite large. The free breakfast was fine, better than most. The staff was courteous and helpful. Best part was the location - easy walk to downtown shopping, the market and Seattle Center. And the rate, given that it was New Years, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds!”
Reviews.Author: 40Acres
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in a downtown hotel. Well within walking distance of downtown and less than half the price of hotels there (plus this one had breakfast, which was pretty good). This hotel had the most comfortable beds I've encountered --- regular construction (springs) but with a nice foam topping --- so good support plus comfort. Which was a good thing, because I got very sick (tooth abcess) and spent several days in the bed! Staff knew I got sick, and were helpful. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “So very smelly”
Reviews.Author: Nosda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nicer, newer La Quinta Inns BUT for the price, location and free parking this deal is really hard to beat. It's only a 10min walk to the retial part of downtown. The area around the hotel is a bit deserted at night but there is nothing to fear. Whole Foods market is a block away at the new Pan Pacific. Besides the Pan, the area is littered with low cost hotels. They are building it up quickly though and I am sure the area will be busier and ever better in the very near future. Ok, now for the weird - this hotel smells so bad. Not on the first floor or lobby but in the hallways and at least in our room. We stayed in room 506 - you could tell it was/is a smoking room but they use so much air freshener - I mean, more air freshener than you have ever smelled in your life. it knocks you over it smells so bad - more than anyone would ever use...ever. (think public beach washroom air freshener x100) Anyway, if you are at all sesitive to scent or headaches, really think twice about this hotel. I am NOT sensitive to scent and it drove me up the wall. I fear what they are trying to cover up. The worst was the next day - me and my friend's hair and clothes reeked of the scent. We kept catching wiffs all day. Anyway, I know that's a weird complaint but I wouldn't stay here again - all because of that. Shame too as everything else was great for the money. Be warned is all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: donny608
Reviews.Content: After arriving at Sea-tac airport and taking the airport shuttle I arrived at the hotel 1:15pm,however a young lady arrived with me at the same time, and was upset because she was told that she could check in earlier. Check out time is 3pm at this hotel,obviously she should have read the fine print. I didn't complain the desk clerk was willing to hold bags behind the desk in a locked safe place, but I was willing to wait until 2pm for a room to be available.Other people showed up after and I let them all check in before I did.
