I was the last one to check in, and because I didn't complain and was nice to everyone I was checked into a room with a king sized bed,and balcony on the sixth floor. The room was all and more than I needed, and I enjoyed being close to local attractions. The breakfast was great,and I liked making waffles.I also liked having fresh cookies at 7pm every nite to have with my inroom coffee. The cleanning ladies changed sheets and cleaned the room really well, and always restocked coffee,and towels as I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, maybe bring an air freshener”
Reviews.Author: TortugasOnTheBeach
Reviews.Content: There are a few issues with this hotel, but overall we were satisfied and had a good stay. We stayed here for 4 nights in August and it suited our needs just fine. Beds: comfortable, we slept well. Bedding seemed a bit old. Room: very spacious- we had 2 queen beds and a desk with a chair. It was good to have the extra room as we had a dog and baby with us. It was quiet- we didn't hear any noise from inside or outside the hotel. Cleanliness: needs some improvement here. There were some hairs on the bathroom floor, and they weren't mine. Air conditioning: worked okay, there were 2 speeds. The windows don't open. We didn't have a balcony but that might be something to ask for. Breakfast: pastries, muffins, yogurt, make your own waffles- it was great to have a good breakfast each morning to start the day. Parking: 10 spots above ground, the rest is underground and around the back through an alley. It was tight but we have a truck with a canopy and we managed to get a space everytime. We saw SUV's parked underground, and even a Hummer (taking up 2 spots, grrr). You do need some good parking skills though. Location: Great! We walked everywhere. The area is not the nicest, with parking lots and some construction around, but we were never afraid. If you want to pay more you can stay more in the heart of downtown. There is a Whole Foods nearby. A great place to grab some food if you don't feel like eating out. There is a fridge and microwave in the room that we used quite a bit. Internet: One computer in lobby. We used it to print out some directions and didn't have to wait long to use it. Dog friendly: Dogs were welcome, no extra charge. Our dog seemed to like the room okay. There is a park nearby (Denny Park) where we took her to pee. There were homeless people in the park, but they never bothered us. The hotel is a bit old, so there are some issues. The elevator wasn't that bad, as others have said, it's just a bit noisy. Yes, there was a strange smell in our room. I couldn't quite place it, or find where it was coming from. It kind of bothered me, but was not a huge deal. An air freshener would have taken care of it. The TV remote did not work, but a call to the front desk fixed that. It was a bit hard to open our door with our keycards. We had to swipe them a few times, then had to get it fixed at the front desk. We chose this hotel because we wanted to stay in downtown Seattle but didn't want to pay too much. It still seemed a bit expensive, but considering we got free parking, free breakfast, and our dog stayed free, it was not too bad. If you don't have a dog and don't have to worry about parking, maybe consider a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here! Terrible !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarge56
Reviews.Content: Located in older area of city, lots of construction going on around hotel. Building looks to be from 40's. Parking scarce and spaces under hotel are too small for most vehicles other than Volkswagen beetles. Lobby is terribly dated. Staff friendly, but that's the only good thing I can say about this hotel. Breakfast items limited to standard boxed pastries, yogurt and cereal. Room was "suite", but air conditioning is still a window unit...and located in the "living area" of the suite. It is on or off. Period. The bedroom only gets whatever a/c might float it's way. The small fan provided in bedroom on top of tv unit was louder than a jackhammer and unusable. TV remote in bedroom did not work. Clock radio was impossible to set (button broken). And NO internet in the rooms. And the internet in the "business center" was not functioning. A receptionist did allow me back into the hotel office to print off a map, but really. Would never stay here again! Don't make the same mistake I made. For $111 a night...NOT worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location weird smell”
Reviews.Author: zProsperity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on short business trip to Seattle. Pros: Excellent location Nice continental breakfast in morning Spacious floor plan in rooms with king bed Neat blowfish in lobby who follows people! Cons: Weird smell in rooms Slow jerky elevator Very limited parking (especially in alley) Construction near location Bathroom old and not kept

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: seattlefan12
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at various hotels in Seattle from the Moore to the Westin. Booked a suite at this La Quinta with my wife and daughter last minute for Bumbershoot which is a few blocks away at Seattle Center. Was pleasantly surprised at the price - must have been their weekend rate. Room was clean, comfortable, bright and fairly spacious for 3 people. The view was interesting, but not awe-inspiring. Desk service was good. Was concerned about neighbourhood a little, which proved to be groundless, and have been more alarmed when staying at the Westin a few blocks away. We walked downtown and back late in the evening with no unpleasant encounters at all. Was also worried about open parking, but this again was no problem, and was free. Good, quiet night's sleep, little street noise. Breakfast was alright, if a little chaotic, seemed to be lots of room to sit.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, But Nice”
Reviews.Author: amycat
Reviews.Content: We decided to travel to Seattle for New Year's and booked this hotel via Hotwire. We got a great deal (I believe it was around $60 per night). As a bonus, we were able to easily walk to the Space Needle and Seattle Center to ring in the New Year and watch the fireworks display there. This was great, because there were cars jammed all up and down the streets during this time, and being able to walk helped us avoid the traffic. Breakfast was good. They have make your own waffles, which were delish, and other goodies to go along with them. A very satisfying meal for a "continental" breakfast. Also, they have fresh baked chocolate chip cookies at night. Our room was on an upper floor with a blacony. The view was of a vacant lot with construction, which wasn't so great...but who wants to hang around outside on a balcony in Seattle in January, anyway? Once the vacant lot is built upon, the view won't be so ugly. But, that's not the hotel's fault. The room was not super fancy, but it was clean, and had ample towels, and beds were fine. I thougt for the price we paid, we got a pretty good deal. I can't really think of much to complain about. Well...I take that back...the location is a TAD on the semi-scary side. One has to pass a small park on the way to the Space Needle (if one is walking to it) and some homeless men seemed to be living in that park. But, they were just minding their own business, so I guess it wasn't really threatening...just a little weird and sad. Overall, we were satisfied, and have no reason to NOT return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly pleased....”
Reviews.Author: Tenn4ever
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean but we had a handicapped equipped room which we really were not pleased with. We are not handicapped but have stayed in rooms designated this before and have had no problem. Usually the doors are wider and there are hand rails in shower/tub/toilet area. This room was completely different. The entire bathroom area was set up like a gym shower with the shower faucet coming directly out of a side wall and the drain in the middle of the bathroom floor. The toilet was in the same area so everything got wet . After a shower the entire bathroom floor was wet with puddles of water the rest of the day. We totally hated it. If this is the only room left at this hotel you may want to think twice before taking it. Also, there was construction going on in front of the hotel - right outside the windows. There was a two-story hole in the ground with huge cranes - ugh. The sidewalks were blocked and also part of the streets so it was difficult to walk to places. I can say the construction noise didn't start until around 8:30 am. Even though the hotel was within walking distance (eight or nine blocks from the Space Needle and also the waterfront) the area was not real desirable. We made sure we were back in the hotel before dark each night. I would not have felt comfortable walking there by myself at all. There is free parking with the hotel so that part was good and the room was very clean. The breakfast was pretty good. There was only one restaurant within a couple blocks - Korean I believe. There was a Whole Food Market about two blocks away which we went to a couple times although we had to walk in the street to get there due to the walks being blocked.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSleeper
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at La Quinta. The rooms were very clean and big. We stayed in a room with a queen sized bed and a sofa, we also had a small balcony with two chairs. The balcony had a view of the space needle. The breakfast was also very good. There was a great selection (as far as free breakfast goes) and the breakfast room was pleasant. They also cookies in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrozenDesert
Reviews.Content: I really cannot think of anything bad to say about this hotel. My cousin and I stayed in a 2 queen room on the top (7th) floor. Slight musty smell as it was raining when we came in and the windows do not open. Furnishings were nice - not worn nor too dated. There is major contstruction going on next door, but no work was going on while we were there. There is a sink inside the bathroom as well as one right outside which is a big plus. The bath towels were large and the shower head was 7 feet high! (That's a shout out to the above 6 feet set that usually have to squat down to wash their hair.) The breakfast was great with the signature free waffles and well stocked. There is also a room off the lobby with a free computer and printer. We actually took the city bus from the airport to the hotel (flew in from Phoenix). It was an express that took us right down town and our stop was about the 3rd one so saved a $30 cab fare. We walked down to the ferry terminal the next day to go to Victoria so an excellent place to stay if you are going on the Victoria Clipper. Our room had a great view of the Space Needle. Absolutely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeOregon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was near the space needle but not easy walking distance to waterfront but was very easy to navigate around there. The free parking was relatively secure and should not be a worry provided one followed proper precautons of not leaving items in the vehicle. Staff was friendly and the Morning breakfast was about a 7 1/2. to 8. Not Embassy suites but well beyond continental. The room was Quiet and clean and the bed very comfortable. It was a very good value compared to major Hotels unless you had a half price major deal somewhere. I liked the location as it was very easy to get to places i needed to go..Pike Street and main core by Pioneer place and Convention center. I would say it would be a 10 minute drive to the Stadiums. I will stay there again next time i am in town.

Reviews.Title: “An unusual stay at La Quinta Seattle Downtown”
Reviews.Author: dragonman64
Reviews.Content: La Quinta Inn & Suites Seattle Downtown has its ups and downs, and it will do well to point out both in order for future guests to know what they are getting themselves into. Let me start with the good points first. Its location, while on the fringes of downtown, is not really that bad if you don’t mind walking. Seattle being a walker-friendly city has a simple lay-out that would not confuse any first-time visitor unless the triangular intersections in some areas get the better of you. If you love to visit the Space Needle though, you’ll be in luck as anyone can leisurely walk to the same in less than 10 minutes. The hotel, formerly known as Hawthorn Suites, has been renovated to reflect the chain’s features. Although the finishing touches still leave much to be desired, there is a distinct homeliness (and dog-friendliness) that will make you feel at ease, especially that the hustle and bustle of activities in the main tourist sections can no longer be heard. The lobby and breakfast areas are clean, just as the small room providing free internet access. There is also an enclosed part which is supposed to be a pseudo-spa with heated Jacuzzi exclusively for guests. The two elevators, however, are so old that only one was functioning during our stay. The room we got was clean with a good toilet/bath. There is a small fridge and microwave very useful when you don’t want to eat out and just buy food from a convenience store two blocks away. Also, the cable TV has about 65 channels available. On the debit side, the balcony was obviously broken into in the past so a long wooden stick was placed on one side of the sliding door to reinforce security. It was reason enough for us not to leave our valuables inside the room when sightseeing or shopping. But one thing which terribly annoyed us was an unusual incident which happened during our second day. Since I am used to giving tips to housekeeping before checking out on the last morning, we left the room expecting the same to be cleaned by the time we return. Sure, it was tidied up, but on the notepad on the bedside table, the phrase “[--] [--]” was scribbled using either a fingernail or pointed object so you cannot easily read without putting the notepad close to your face. This alarmed us but thought it best to complain about the scribble the following morning to the manager. We were not sure yet if it was really housekeeping who did the same. Night came and passed and when I was taking a shower, the bathtub felt like it was rocking like a boat. It made me so dizzy that I stepped out of the room for fresh air after dressing up. At that point, my mother (who was reading the morning paper in her bed) told me that she felt something cold blew at the back of her neck while I was in the shower. She also added that “someone” (or a spirit) quickly walked by the balcony door going to the room entrance. This happened (including the rocking boat shower) for two days and it was a good thing we were already about to leave thereafter. Now, I don’t want to make this review sound like a ghost story or something, but it surely made our skin crawl. In fairness to the hotel, the people at front desk were very easy to deal with. They always went out of their way for any small request or question we had. The complimentary breakfast items are constantly replenished and it always starts our day full and bright. Never mind the morning ‘presence’ in the room. We’re more afraid of thieves/robbers anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel reasonably priced and located near downtown, with easy walking distance to Space Needle and not that far to Pike Place Market. [Little longer walk, but possible]. Room was spacious and clean. Had refrigerator, microwave. Staff very helpful and friendly, got us transportation to airport, restaurant, for example. Sent me back my phone charger, which I left behind, at no charge. Neighborhood so so, but never felt threatened, even at night. Decent continental breakfast provided, including self-made waffles. All in all, the hotel was very nice, especially for the price, we would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Seattle Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 2224 8th Ave., Seattle, WA 98121
